intro: Arabis patens, commonly known as the rock白菜 or rock mustard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun, often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Its small, white or yellow flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces distinctive triangular seed pods. Arabis patens is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
